bioghist.p: Duff Green (1791-1875) was an American politician, journalist, and an influential member of President Andrew Jackson's inner advisory circle, the “Kitchen Cabinet.”

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photocopies of correspondence from 1826-1834. The letters relate to Green's involvement in presidential politics, particularly his newspaper articles advocating for Andrew Jackson, and later John C. Calhoun, and his articles criticizing Martin Van Buren and Jackson. There are a number of letters between Richard K. Gralle and Green. Other correspondents represented in the collection are George Sharswood, Jesse Hoyt, and Van Buren.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
